place.name: FERRING
place.gazetteerText: FERRING, a parish in Worthing district, Sussex; on the coast, and on the South Coast railway, 1 mile W of Goring r. station, and 3½ W of Worthing. It has a post office, of the name of West Ferring, under Worthing. Acres, 1, 055; of which 120 are water. Real property, £2, 158. Pop., 253. Houses, 58. The property is not much divided. The living is a vicarage, united with Kingston and East Preston, in the dio. of Chichester. Value, £427.* Patron, the Bishop ofThe church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
